title: Code Signing
descrption: Code signing provides a level of authenticity on a binary from the developer and a guarantee that the binary has not been tampered with. [1] However, adversaries are known to use code signing certificates to masquerade malware and tools as legitimate binaries [2]. The certificates used during an operation may be created, forged, or stolen by the adversary. [3] [4]Code signing to verify software on first run can be used on modern Windows and macOS/OS X systems. It is not used on Linux due to the decentralized nature of the platform. [1]Code signing certificates may be used to bypass security policies that require signed code to execute on a system.

related.Name: APT37
related.Description: APT37 has signed its malware with an invalid digital certificates listed as "Tencent Technology (Shenzhen) Company Limited."[32]

related.Name: APT41
related.Description: APT41 leveraged code-signing certificates to sign malware when targeting both gaming and non-gaming organizations.[39]

related.Name: BADNEWS
related.Description: BADNEWS is sometimes signed with an invalid Authenticode certificate in an apparent effort to make it look more legitimate.[16]

related.Name: BOOSTWRITE
related.Description: BOOSTWRITE has been signed by a valid CA.[24]

related.Name: ChChes
related.Description: ChChes samples were digitally signed with a certificate originally used by Hacking Team that was later leaked and subsequently revoked.[10][11][12]

related.Name: CopyKittens
related.Description: CopyKittens digitally signed an executable with a stolen certificate from legitimate company AI Squared.[30]

related.Name: Darkhotel
related.Description: Darkhotel has used code-signing certificates on its malware that are either forged due to weak keys or stolen. Darkhotel has also stolen certificates and signed backdoors and downloaders with them.[27][28]

related.Name: Daserf
related.Description: Some Daserf samples were signed with a stolen digital certificate.[7]

related.Name: Ebury
related.Description: Ebury has installed a self-signed RPM package mimicking the original system package on RPM based systems.[21]

related.Name: Epic
related.Description: Turla has used valid digital certificates from Sysprint AG to sign its Epic dropper.[20]

related.Name: FIN6
related.Description: FIN6 has used Comodo code-signing certificates.    [23]

related.Name: FIN7
related.Description: FIN7 has signed Carbanak payloads with legally purchased code signing certificates. FIN7 has also digitally signed their phishing documents, backdoors and other staging tools to bypass security controls.[25][26]

related.Name: Gazer
related.Description: Gazer versions are signed with various valid certificates; one was likely faked and issued by Comodo for "Solid Loop Ltd," and another was issued for "Ultimate Computer Support Ltd."[14][15]

related.Name: GreyEnergy
related.Description: GreyEnergy digitally signs the malware with a code-signing certificate.[19]

related.Name: Helminth
related.Description: Helminth samples have been signed with legitimate, compromised code signing certificates owned by software company AI Squared.[8]

related.Name: Honeybee
related.Description: Honeybee uses a dropper called MaoCheng that harvests a stolen digital signature from Adobe Systems.[35]

related.Name: Janicab
related.Description: Janicab used a valid AppleDeveloperID to sign the code to get past security restrictions.[2]

related.Name: Leviathan
related.Description: Leviathan has used stolen code signing certificates to sign malware.[33][34]

related.Name: LockerGoga
related.Description: LockerGoga has been signed with stolen certificates in order to make it look more legitimate.[22]

related.Name: Molerats
related.Description: Molerats has used forged Microsoft code-signing certificates on malware.[31]

related.Name: More_eggs
related.Description: More_eggs has used a signed binary shellcode loader and a signed Dynamic Link Library (DLL) to create a reverse shell.[23]

related.Name: Nerex
related.Description: Nerex drops a signed Microsoft DLL to disk.[9]

related.Name: NETWIRE
related.Description: The NETWIRE client has been signed by fake and invalid digital certificates.[13]

related.Name: QuasarRAT
related.Description: A QuasarRAT .dll file is digitally signed by a certificate from AirVPN.[5]

related.Name: Regin
related.Description: Regin stage 1 modules for 64-bit systems have been found to be signed with fake certificates masquerading as originating from Microsoft Corporation and Broadcom Corporation.[18]

related.Name: RTM
related.Description: RTM samples have been signed with a code-signing certificates.[17]

related.Name: SDelete
related.Description: SDelete is digitally signed by Microsoft.[6]

related.Name: Suckfly
related.Description: Suckfly has used stolen certificates to sign its malware.[36]

related.Name: TA505
related.Description: TA505 has signed payloads with code signing certificates from Thawte and Sectigo.[37][38]

related.Name: Winnti Group
related.Description: Winnti Group used stolen certificates to sign its malware.[29]
